column4: hello all, when i insert a pendrive (while using gnome) it does not automatically detect, and dunno the file in /dev to mount so am unable to use pendrive plz help
plug in the drive then run 'dmesg | tail' in a terminal, it should tell you if there is an error with the drive or how it was assigned.
when i insert cdrom also it automatically is not mounted help...
plz temme what i have to add in fstab so that when  i insert a cdrom it automatically gets mounted
Falstius,and one more thing when i use kde, pendrive automatically gets detected
my fstab entry for cdrom is: /dev/cdrom      /media/cdrom0   udf,iso9660 user,noauto     0       0
when you install gnome, did you do it with apt-get intall ubuntu-desktop  ?
plz temme what i have to add in fstab so that when  i insert a cdrom it automatically gets mountedanyone
thanks
Falstius,hey
Falstius,when i insert the pen drive while using kde it automatically gets detected
I saw that.  I asked how you installed gnome.
Falstius,i installed ubuntu fiesty from the install dvd, i got gnome for default
and then i installed kde :)
possibly installing kde broke gnome.  I can't tell you how to fix it.
Falstius,lol
Falstius,how could that happen?
gnome uses HAL to automount devices.  I don't know what kde uses, they may be incompatible.
Falstius,hey do you know about what gnome is providing in default for "desktop effects"??i guess compiz is it so?
for feisty if you install desktop effects it is compiz.  Beryl can be installed to (I ran it until I went dual monitor)
plz tell how do i add extra workspace
Falstius,i have got nvidia 7600 graphics card with 256mb graphic memory so am running compiz very successfully .. enjoying linux :)
right click on the workspace swticher, chose preferences
